articles.headline: How Two Teenagers Became the New Faces of Iran’s Protests
articles.snippet: The 16-year-old girls were killed by the Iranian security services in a crackdown on the protests that have rocked the country for the past month.
articles.abstract: The 16-year-old girls were killed by the Iranian security services in a crackdown on the protests that have rocked the country for the past month.
articles.lead_paragraph: As unrest erupted across Iran calling for an end to the Islamic Republic’s rule last month, with young women in big cities and small towns tossing their headscarves onto bonfires to chants of “Women, Life, Freedom,” two teenage girls left their homes to join the protesters.

articles.headline: Grocery Giants Kroger and Albertsons Are Said to Be in Merger Talks
articles.snippet: A deal could be the industry’s largest in years and would almost certainly invite antitrust scrutiny from regulators.
articles.abstract: A deal could be the industry’s largest in years and would almost certainly invite antitrust scrutiny from regulators.
articles.lead_paragraph: The grocery giants Albertsons and Kroger are in talks to combine in a deal that would be one of the industry’s largest in years, creating a colossal food retailer aimed at taking on Walmart, four people with knowledge of the plans said.
articles.byline: By Lauren Hirsch and Julie Creswell

articles.headline: A Central Bank on the High Wire
articles.snippet: Andrew Bailey, the Bank of England chief, is trying to calm markets, wrestle inflation and maintain the bank’s credibility amid Britain’s financial storm.
articles.abstract: Andrew Bailey, the Bank of England chief, is trying to calm markets, wrestle inflation and maintain the bank’s credibility amid Britain’s financial storm.
articles.lead_paragraph: Andrew Bailey is in an unenviable position. As governor of the Bank of England, he must rein in inflation, which is rising at the fastest pace in 40 years.

articles.headline: Supreme Court Rejects Trump Request to Intervene in Documents Case
articles.snippet: Without any noted dissents, the court issued a one-sentence statement that amounted to a rebuke to the former president.
articles.abstract: Without any noted dissents, the court issued a one-sentence statement that amounted to a rebuke to the former president.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court on Thursday rejected a request from former President Donald J. Trump to intervene in the litigation over documents seized from his Florida estate, a stinging rebuke that blocked his effort to get access to classified documents found there by the F.B.I.

articles.headline: ‘Uncle Xi’ to Exalted Ruler: China’s Leader Embodies His Authoritarian Era
articles.snippet: Xi Jinping was first cast as a firm but genial leader with a common touch. Approaching a second decade in power, he looms over China like a stern Communist monarch.
articles.abstract: Xi Jinping was first cast as a firm but genial leader with a common touch. Approaching a second decade in power, he looms over China like a stern Communist monarch.
articles.lead_paragraph: In his first years as China’s leader, Xi Jinping paid for his own steamed dumplings in a cheap diner, casually rolled up his trouser legs to avoid splashes in the rain, and was serenaded with sugary pop tunes. His image-makers cast him as “Xi Dada,” the people’s firm but genial “Uncle Xi.”

articles.headline: Reno Is Booming. Some Workers Feel Left Behind.
articles.snippet: Companies are flocking to the Nevada city, but the rising cost of housing, gas and groceries is making daily life a struggle for many who work there.
articles.abstract: Companies are flocking to the Nevada city, but the rising cost of housing, gas and groceries is making daily life a struggle for many who work there.
articles.lead_paragraph: As an employee at a UPS warehouse outside Reno, Nev., Christina Pixton spends her nights moving thousands of heavy packages on their way to far-flung locales like San Francisco, Phoenix and Chicago.
articles.byline: By Jordyn Holman and Deanne Fitzmaurice

articles.headline: Kroger and Albertsons Plan $25 Billion Supermarket Merger That May Face Hurdles
articles.snippet: The deal, an effort to bulk up against deep-pocketed rivals Walmart and Amazon, is likely to invite serious antitrust scrutiny from regulators.
articles.abstract: The deal, an effort to bulk up against deep-pocketed rivals Walmart and Amazon, is likely to invite serious antitrust scrutiny from regulators.
articles.lead_paragraph: Two of the country’s largest supermarket chains announced plans on Friday to merge in a deal that could alter the food retail landscape but will also face intense scrutiny by regulators.
articles.byline: By Lauren Hirsch, Julie Creswell and Jordyn Holman
